name: Next up: A Neat "N" Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
North Carolina.

	Andy Griffith was born on June 1, 1926 in Mount Airy, North Carolina. He died on July 3, 2012.

questions.text: What location is "second star to the right; straight on till morning"?
questions.explanation:
Neverland.

	Neverland is the home of Peter Pan. There has been many stories of Peter Pan made, but the original book was written by J.M. Barrie.

Nimrod.

	Nimrod also translates as "great warrior".

questions.text: Which word is used to mean a female who is obsessed with sex?
questions.explanation:
nymphomaniac.

	The word nymphomaniac comes from "nymph" and of course "maniac". The nymphs in Greek mythology were female spirits in nature. They could stop men from doing something or getting somewhere, because men would easily fall in love with them.

questions.text: Which of the following words is an adverb?
questions.explanation:
now.

	An adverb describes a verb, adjective or another adverb. In the following sentence quickly is the adverb "The dog quickly caught the ball." Quickly tells us how he caught the verb. So caught is the verb and quickly is the adverb.

questions.text: Who was the first US president to resign from office?
questions.explanation:
Nixon & Richard Nixon.

	Richard Nixon resigned from his position as president because of the Watergate Scandal.

questions.text: Which music group of the 1990s shares its name with a term in Buddhism?
questions.explanation:
Nirvana.

	Nirvana the group sang the song "Where Did You Sleep Last Night."  In Buddhism, nirvana is the level Buddhists try to reach where they achieve self-enlightenment.

questions.text: What is the name of Filch's cat in "Harry Potter"? Mrs. ________?
questions.explanation:
Norris.

	Mrs. Norris helps Filch patrol the halls, and like Filch she's not very fond of Harry Potter, or any of the other students for that matter.

questions.text: What New York sporting team's colors are green and white?
questions.explanation:
New York Jets.

	In 1969 the Jets became the first AFL team to win the Superbowl. They beat the Baltimore Colts 16-7. I found this information at http://www.newyorkjets.com/stats.

questions.text: Who was the star of the TV show "Walker, Texas Ranger"?
questions.explanation:
Norris & Chuck Norris.

	Chuck Norris also sang the theme song for "Walker, Texas Ranger".
